issue.title: Improve CI for macOS on Apple Silicon
issue.body:
Due to poor CI support this is currently a Tier 3 system according to our PLATFORMS.md document, but it should be better.

https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/pull/1605#discussion_r1414029843

comment.body:
> It would be great to start using this and move away from our ad hoc solution involving one of our own machines.

We presently do that basically for profiling (in the process also testing). Indeed it would be nice to also do that on github (weekly run) if we decide to keep that sub project alive...

issue.title: Crosscompilation from linux to windows fails

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working; high priority to fix

labels.name: platform-specific
labels.description: Issue related to a specific platform configuration; core team may not have required platform

issue.body:
# Expected
I expected this code to create liboqs.dll in bin folder.

> This will generate a bin/liboqs.dll file in the build directory that you will need to copy to Windows. You should configure it to be available via the PATH environment variable.

[Cross compilation wiki (linux -> windows dll)](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/wiki/Platform-specific-notes-for-building-liboqs#cross-compiling)

# Replication
```bash
sudo apt install cmake gcc gcc-mingw-w64 ninja-build
git clone https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs
cd liboqs
mkdir build
cd build
cmake -GNinja -DCMAKE_TOOLCHAIN_FILE=../.CMake/toolchain_windows-amd64.cmake -DOQS_DIST_BUILD=ON -DBUILD_SHARED_LIBS=ON ..
ninja
```

## Additional
I am not very smart and I am grateful that you are spending your time on me.
Thanks.

comment.body:
> -DOQS_BUILD_ONLY_LIB=ON

Arguably another snafu on our side -- reopening the issue to also look into that...

> Thanks for help and sorry for bad grammar

Grammar doesn't matter (I'm a non-native speaker myself and don't realize :) What matters is thoroughness (reading up on stuff and getting to the ground of things) and cooperation (reporting/retesting): You demonstrate both: Thanks very much!

issue.title: Not able to get OQS-Chromium browser working - https://openquantumsafe.org/applications/tls.html#chromium
issue.body:
https://openquantumsafe.org/applications/tls.html#chromium
I am not able to use this Chromium browser testing any post Post-quantum servers like-  https://test.openquantumsafe.org:6028/.
Intially, I installed it on Ubuntu 20.04 but since this was not working then moved to Ubuntu 22.04, then also this is not working.

I really appreciate your attention in this matter.

comment.body:
@baentsch 
@igorbarshteyn 

**"Note: By default, only the algorithms "p521_kyber1024:kyber768:x25519" are supported by the configuration built into this Docker image."**

So I took "https://test.openquantumsafe.org:6130/" and I am facing the following error -

**"The precise error was: Peer failed to perform TLS handshake: sslv3 alert handshake failure"**

Snapshot attached for reference.

![Screenshot from 2024-02-13 12-45-14](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-demos/assets/147039780/1d7d96ba-4e09-45a2-b9bb-3464a866e037)

issue.title: Fix cross compilation and test in CI
issue.body:
<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->

The recent addition of the `oqs-internal` library broke cross compilation for Windows due to differing object visibility defaults for Linux and Windows.

This is pending our Focal container being updated to install `gcc-mingw-w64`.

I also took the opportunity to update our `checkout` workflows to v4, which will make the GitHub Actions deprecation warnings go away.

<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->

Fixes #1693.

<!-- Any PR adding a new feature is expected to contain a test; the test should be part of CI testing, preferably within the ".github/workflows" directory tree. Please add an explanation to the PR if/when (why) this cannot be done. -->

<!-- Please answer the following questions to help manage version and changes across projects. -->

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [ ] Does this PR change the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming? Does this PR otherwise change an API? (If so, PRs in fully supported downstream projects dependent on these, i.e., [oqs-provider](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider) and [OQS-OpenSSH](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh) will also need to be ready for review and merge by the time this is merged.)

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review from one of the OQS core team members. -->

comment.body: The container has been updated and the tests all pass, including the new ones for cross-compilation.

issue.title: Change XMSS License from `(Apache 2.0 AND MIT)` to `(Apache 2.0 OR MIT) AND CC0-1.0`
issue.body:
<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->

According to liboqs maintainer request, this PR change the license of XMSS contribution from 
`(Apache 2.0 AND MIT)` to `(Apache 2.0 OR MIT) AND CC0-1.0`.


1. Moved standalone LICENSE-MIT into LICENSE file.
2. A few newlines, spaces format. 



<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->

<!-- Any PR adding a new feature is expected to contain a test; the test should be part of CI testing, preferably within the ".github/workflows" directory tree. Please add an explanation to the PR if/when (why) this cannot be done. -->

<!-- Please answer the following questions to help manage version and changes across projects. -->

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [ ] Does this PR change the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming? Does this PR otherwise change an API? (If so, PRs in fully supported downstream projects dependent on these, i.e., [oqs-provider](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider) and [OQS-OpenSSH](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh) will also need to be ready for review and merge by the time this is merged.)

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review from one of the OQS core team members. -->

comment.body: @baentsch , no worry, thank you very much for reviewing the PR. Without you I couldn't catch these problems myself.

issue.title: Crosscompilation from linux to windows fails

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working; high priority to fix

labels.name: platform-specific
labels.description: Issue related to a specific platform configuration; core team may not have required platform

issue.body:

I expected this code to create liboqs.dll in bin folder.

> This will generate a bin/liboqs.dll file in the build directory that you will need to copy to Windows. You should configure it to be available via the PATH environment variable.

[Cross compilation wiki (linux -> windows dll)](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/wiki/Platform-specific-notes-for-building-liboqs#cross-compiling)

```bash
sudo apt install cmake gcc gcc-mingw-w64 ninja-build
git clone https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs
cd liboqs
mkdir build
cd build
cmake -GNinja -DCMAKE_TOOLCHAIN_FILE=../.CMake/toolchain_windows-amd64.cmake -DOQS_DIST_BUILD=ON -DBUILD_SHARED_LIBS=ON ..
ninja
```

comment.body:
> I had to append -DOQS_BUILD_ONLY_LIB=ON to the compilation command to make it work

Just retested after the latest changes by @SWilson4 and it works regardless of the setting of "OQS_BUILD_ONLY_LIB", so please check again whether this still is a problem for you (assuming you set `BUILD_SHARED_LIBS=ON` to get a .dll), @FunDan3 . Without further report (maybe via a new issue) we consider this resolved for good.

issue.title: Crosscompilation from linux to windows fails

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working; high priority to fix

labels.name: platform-specific
labels.description: Issue related to a specific platform configuration; core team may not have required platform

issue.body:

I expected this code to create liboqs.dll in bin folder.

> This will generate a bin/liboqs.dll file in the build directory that you will need to copy to Windows. You should configure it to be available via the PATH environment variable.

[Cross compilation wiki (linux -> windows dll)](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/wiki/Platform-specific-notes-for-building-liboqs#cross-compiling)

# Replication
```bash
sudo apt install cmake gcc gcc-mingw-w64 ninja-build
git clone https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs
cd liboqs
mkdir build
cd build
cmake -GNinja -DCMAKE_TOOLCHAIN_FILE=../.CMake/toolchain_windows-amd64.cmake -DOQS_DIST_BUILD=ON -DBUILD_SHARED_LIBS=ON ..
ninja
```

comment.body: Hello. I tested it and it does indeed work. Thanks for help, again!

issue.title: Add ML-DSA-ipd and ML-KEM-ipd & NIST supplied test vectors
issue.body:
Pull ML-DSA-ipd / ML-KEM-ipd from pq-crystals "standard" branch.
Adds test cases with NIST supplied test vectors: https://csrc.nist.gov/Projects/post-quantum-cryptography/post-quantum-cryptography-standardization/example-files (see also _Note on the intermediate values for ML-KEM:_ and _Note on the intermediate values for ML-DSA:_)

The NIST files are rather large (several MB) and we only use parts of the data that can be passed via the public API + randomness. So we process them and store only the data we need in `tests/PQC_Intermediate_Values` (script is included to reproduce the files)

The PR adds new test code vectors_sig.c and vectors_kem.c that for testing the NIST vectors.

The idea is to keep the current Kyber/Dilithium (round 3) versions for compatibility reasons, and add the ML-* algorithms additionally.

The naming of the algorithms is done following the IETF hackathon: ML-DSA-44-ipd, ML-DSA-65-ipd, ML-DSA-87-ipd, ML-KEM-512-ipd, ML-KEM-768-ipd, ML-KEM-1024-ipd: https://github.com/IETF-Hackathon/pqc-certificates/blob/master/docs/oid_mapping.md

TODOs:
- [x] Add NIST supplied test vectors and code to test them
- [x] Compact NIST test vectors: the files are quite large and we need only a small part of the value
- [x] Pull ML-DSA-ipd from pq-crystals "standard" branch
- [x] Pull ML-KEM-ipd from pq-crystals "standard" branch
- [x] add patches for copy_from_upstream (for renaming to ML-KEM-ipd / ML-DSA-ipd)
- [ ] ~~Pull pqclean aarch64 code (may omit for now)~~
- [x] Integrate tests with CI
- [x] Update docs
- [x] Ensure updating to latest upstream versions (e.g. with Kyberslash fixes)
- [x] Run constant-time tests on new algorithms & update valgrind files

Closes #1521.

<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->

<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->

<!-- Any PR adding a new feature is expected to contain a test; the test should be part of CI testing, preferably within the ".github/workflows" directory tree. Please add an explanation to the PR if/when (why) this cannot be done. -->

<!-- Please answer the following questions to help manage version and changes across projects. -->

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [x] Does this PR change the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming? Does this PR otherwise change an API? (If so, PRs in fully supported downstream projects dependent on these, i.e., [oqs-provider](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider) and [OQS-OpenSSH](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh) will also need to be ready for review and merge by the time this is merged.)

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review from one of the OQS core team members. -->

comment.body: @SWilson4 I did see the trigger event going out to `oqsprovider` -- but I didn't find any indication of this having resulted in a run anywhere... Would you know where to look?

issue.body:
Pull ML-DSA-ipd / ML-KEM-ipd from pq-crystals "standard" branch.

The PR adds new test code vectors_sig.c and vectors_kem.c that for testing the NIST vectors.

The idea is to keep the current Kyber/Dilithium (round 3) versions for compatibility reasons, and add the ML-* algorithms additionally.

The naming of the algorithms is done following the IETF hackathon: ML-DSA-44-ipd, ML-DSA-65-ipd, ML-DSA-87-ipd, ML-KEM-512-ipd, ML-KEM-768-ipd, ML-KEM-1024-ipd: https://github.com/IETF-Hackathon/pqc-certificates/blob/master/docs/oid_mapping.md

- [x] Pull ML-KEM-ipd from pq-crystals "standard" branch
- [x] add patches for copy_from_upstream (for renaming to ML-KEM-ipd / ML-DSA-ipd)
- [ ] ~~Pull pqclean aarch64 code (may omit for now)~~
- [x] Integrate tests with CI
- [x] Update docs
- [x] Ensure updating to latest upstream versions (e.g. with Kyberslash fixes)
- [x] Run constant-time tests on new algorithms & update valgrind files

Closes #1521.

<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->

<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->

<!-- Any PR adding a new feature is expected to contain a test; the test should be part of CI testing, preferably within the ".github/workflows" directory tree. Please add an explanation to the PR if/when (why) this cannot be done. -->

<!-- Please answer the following questions to help manage version and changes across projects. -->

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [x] Does this PR change the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming? Does this PR otherwise change an API? (If so, PRs in fully supported downstream projects dependent on these, i.e., [oqs-provider](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider) and [OQS-OpenSSH](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh) will also need to be ready for review and merge by the time this is merged.)

comment.body:
> @SWilson4 I did see the trigger event going out to `oqsprovider` -- but I didn't find any indication of this having resulted in a run anywhere... Would you know where to look?

Looks like this was the triggered run: https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider/actions/runs/7826280145

You can find them in the "Actions" tab under "Release tests": https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider/actions/workflows/release.yml. It's admittedly not very clear which run corresponds to which upstream trigger; I had to go look at the logs to see which refs were checked out. Not sure how to improve that.

issue.title: Refactor OpenSSL Implementation of SHA3 SHAKE to use new Squeeze API
issue.body:
<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->
Refactor OpenSSL Implementation of SHA3 SHAKE to use new `EVP_DigestSqueeze()` allowing for multiple calls to squeeze

<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->
Resolves #1539

<!-- Any PR adding a new feature is expected to contain a test; the test should be part of CI testing, preferably within the ".github/workflows" directory tree. Please add an explanation to the PR if/when (why) this cannot be done. -->

<!-- Please answer the following questions to help manage version and changes across projects. -->

Please correct me if I'm wrong but it looks like `n_out` of `intrn_shake*_inc_ctx`s are used solely to keep track of the byte number of the input and are unnecessary with the new Squeeze API. The `test_sha3` test ran fine when I removed all instances of `n_out` so I'm curious if this is no longer necessary. 

If `n_out` is indeed unnecessary, then perhaps we can also remove the wrapper structs `intrn_shake128_inc_ctx` and `intrn_shake256_inc_ctx` and instead point `state->ctx` directly to an instance of `EVP_MD_CTX`.

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [ ] Does this PR change the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming? Does this PR otherwise change an API? (If so, PRs in fully supported downstream projects dependent on these, i.e., [oqs-provider](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider) and [OQS-OpenSSH](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh) will also need to be ready for review and merge by the time this is merged.)

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review from one of the OQS core team members. -->

comment.body: Oh right, completely forgot about backward compatibility with the current version. Thank you @beldmit and @baentsch - will fix this.

issue.title: Improve CI for macOS on Apple Silicon
issue.body:
Due to poor CI support this is currently a Tier 3 system according to our PLATFORMS.md document, but it should be better.

https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/pull/1605#discussion_r1414029843

comment.body:
Related to today's meeting: GitHub Actions does seem to have Arm runners, which are currently in private beta: https://github.blog/changelog/2023-10-30-accelerate-your-ci-cd-with-arm-based-hosted-runners-in-github-actions

A GitHub executive recently mentioned in the OQS GitHub that they had helped to get LF projects additional GitHub features in the pastperhaps it's worth following up with them to see if we can get into the private beta?

issue.title: Refactor OpenSSL Implementation of SHA3 SHAKE to use new Squeeze API
issue.body:
<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->
Refactor OpenSSL Implementation of SHA3 SHAKE to use new `EVP_DigestSqueeze()` allowing for multiple calls to squeeze

<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->
Resolves #1539

<!-- Any PR adding a new feature is expected to contain a test; the test should be part of CI testing, preferably within the ".github/workflows" directory tree. Please add an explanation to the PR if/when (why) this cannot be done. -->

<!-- Please answer the following questions to help manage version and changes across projects. -->

Please correct me if I'm wrong but it looks like `n_out` of `intrn_shake*_inc_ctx`s are used solely to keep track of the byte number of the input and are unnecessary with the new Squeeze API. The `test_sha3` test ran fine when I removed all instances of `n_out` so I'm curious if this is no longer necessary. 

If `n_out` is indeed unnecessary, then perhaps we can also remove the wrapper structs `intrn_shake128_inc_ctx` and `intrn_shake256_inc_ctx` and instead point `state->ctx` directly to an instance of `EVP_MD_CTX`.

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [ ] Does this PR change the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming? Does this PR otherwise change an API? (If so, PRs in fully supported downstream projects dependent on these, i.e., [oqs-provider](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider) and [OQS-OpenSSH](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh) will also need to be ready for review and merge by the time this is merged.)

comment.body:
> You may also consider adding "-DOQS_USE_SHA3_OPENSSL=ON" to [this CI test](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/blob/3e34ed18548d504aadc0edf0fac53af5f664a7be/.github/workflows/linux.yml#L90) which is using 3.0.2 and maybe some other "OpenSSL master" test to test-drive the OpenSSL SHA3 code more regularly (as "OQS_USE_SHA3_OPENSSL" is OFF by default).

@baentsch Do you happen to know which jobs (if any) use OpenSSL `master`? It looks to me based on CI logs like all of our GitHub Actions runs are using either 1.1.1 or 3.0.2. If there indeed aren't any, should one be added? Or is that better left for downstream testing with the provider?
